page.title: 08WIMBLEBALL RESERVOIR
page.content: The Withiel Florey stream enters from the north. Wimbleball Lake was opened for fishing on the 1st May,1980. Since then 85,000 trout have been caught.The largest up to date was a rainbow trout weighing 8lb 8oz. Wimbleball Lake offers three types of trout rainbow, brown and tiger. There are three main car parks, a picnic site and a childrens adventure playground on the shores of the lake. Car parking is 20p a day. There is an information centre at Cowlings on the west shore of the lake and here refreshments are available from a mobile kiosk. This is in fact one of only two places where you can buy food in this. The kiosk sells coffee (large polystyrene cups of it - very good), ice cream, hot soup, sandwiches, sweets etc.
